author: yokem55
content:
The problem with establishing a pow fork post merge isn't technical, it's the social coordination. The miners sponsoring the fork would have to come to an agreement on whether to kill the ice age or postpone it, whether to change the mining algo to something not asic friendly or not, whether to keep 1559 or not, and decide on a sensible gas limit given the likely low value of the chain and likelihood of spam attacks.

Then the reality would set in that any fiat liquidity for powEth that appeared would be dumped on by pre-merge holders. Which means big decisions about creating a lock or burn on pre-fork holdings.

All these are solveable problems, given enough time, but it takes far more work then just fixing the ice age.

Minimizing that runway to make those decisions in which there is a functioning but zombie chain is very much in the interests of the developers of the proof of stake chain.

author: yokem55
content: And small bumps to the ice age dont need to take weeks. The geth update that fixed the evm bug last august was pushed out within a week or so. In my mind, the costs of small ice age bumps are low compared to the costs of a zombie chain hanging out for months.

author: benjaminion
content: For those vigorously hand-wringing over increased block times - remember that _temporarily_ increasing the block gas limit to compensate is an option that will not do any long-term damage.
